body:
@piotrkolanowski I've tried uploading a 10gb file and have been unable to reproduce this issue. The upload_file function automatically uses multipart upload under the hood when necessary ([boto3 docs](https://boto3.amazonaws.com/v1/documentation/api/latest/guide/s3-uploading-files.html)). Could you enable debug logs for boto3 so we can see what is going on? Something like this:
```
import logging
logging.basicConfig()
logging.getLogger().setLevel(logging.DEBUG)

# The rest of your code
```

Hi @sebastiaanboer-db, thanks fo looking into this issue. 

using the code

```
import logging
logging.basicConfig()
logging.getLogger().setLevel(logging.DEBUG)

mlflow.log_artifact("/Users/the_user/tiny.txt", "model")  # ca. 4 B  
mlflow.log_artifact("/Users/the_user/big.txt", "model")  # ca. 5.4 GB
```
The small file gets uploaded, the big one does not (also all files unter 5GB can be uploaded, above cannot).

The logs:

Nothing immediately stands out to me. Could you enable boto3 logging explicitly as well, something like the snippet below?
```
import logging
logging.basicConfig()
logging.getLogger().setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
logging.getLogger('boto3').setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
```

Boto3's github repo also doesn't show related issues, other than updating boto3 to the latest version. Could you try that as well?

Thanks for looking into this. 

Good point with newest boto3. To make a clean test I created new venv with python 3.8.12 and 
installed newest mlflow and boto3 available only.
Still does not work on the big files while working on small ones. 
The error message is different though.
Unfortunatelly log doesn't contain anything boto3 / botocore specific. 
I've set the logging level on boto3 / botocore to debug and it dit work fine (has logged a lot) on simple 
boto3_client.list_buckets() test. During the test with mlflow it does not log anything for boto3 / botocore.
Does mlflow override the logging settings for boto3 / used libs?

### python:

### full code

```
import mlflow
import logging
import boto3
logging.basicConfig()
logging.getLogger().setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
logging.getLogger('boto3').setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
boto3.set_stream_logger('boto3', logging.DEBUG)
boto3.set_stream_logger('botocore', logging.DEBUG)

with mlflow.start_run(run_name="run_name", experiment_id="4711") as run:
    print(run.info.run_id)
    mlflow.log_artifact("/Users/the_user/big.txt", "model")  # ca. 5.4 GB
```

Ah I see! I thought this was for the s3 artifact repository directly, but it looks like the issue occurs when using the databricks artifact repository on S3. The latter doesn't currently support multipart upload (for the reason you mentioned in the description). Implementation is in `mlflow/store/artifact/databricks_artifact_repo.py`. Could you plz update the title / description to mention the databricks artifact repository?

rename.from: [BUG] 'log_artifact' and 'log_model' methods does not support files bigger than 5GB on s3
rename.to: [BUG] 'log_artifact' and 'log_model' methods does not support files bigger than 5GB when using databricks artifact repository on S3.

body:
@dbczumar @sebastiaanboer-db I've updated the title and description to mention the databricks artifact repository. 
Please include the fix for this bug in the next patch / release, as it becomes urgent issue for us.

Hey @dbczumar and @sebastiaanboer-db, do you have any estimate on when the fix for this will be made? We're running into the same issue at Nextdoor when trying to upload a large (~10gb) model artifact. Let me know if you need any more info.
